content.description: Climb the right most crack on the overhang. You may want to tape up for this one, as it eats hands.Sit start low, and use the crack and face holds to top out.Claim the FA and update the name/grade. MP made me grade and star it to share
content.location: Right most crack on the steep overhang. See area map and route photo

content.description: Climb the center block like you would a refrigerator. Sit start using the cracks from the problems on the left and the right. Cool movement and harder than it looks.Climb it cleanly, then claim the name, grade, and FA
Climb the thin crack on the left side of the boulder.You climb it, grade it, name it. Felt v5 or v6? MP made me stick a grade to share.
content.location: See area location map. See beta photo.

content.description: Sit start low with both hands low on the crack, one hand in a spot where a hold blew off shortly before the FA. Find a left food on the face under the overhang and pull a hard first move to gain a good left hand at the top of the crack below roof. Figure out the hard and awkward beta to get a left foot on the face that hangs over your shoulder when you start the climb, then put for the effort to top out using feet in the crack to the right of the problem, and some bearfight/beached whale action.
content.location: The left most line on the boulder.

content.description:
This small boulder has 4 quality lines. The movement is steep, powerful, and quality. For being so short, the problems have a lot more movement than one would expect. 

  As of fall 2020, only one of the 4 has been sent, so 3 of the lines are waiting for a deserving FA.
